text: Brenda Milner, (born July 15, 1918) is a British-Canadian neuropsychologist. Her work focused on the field of clinical neuropsychology,Birchard, Karen (November 6, 2011) " 'Nosy' and Observant, a Neuroscientist Continues Her Memorable Career at 93", Chronicle of Higher Education is sometimes known as "the founder of neuropsychology". Milner is a professor in the Department of Neurology and Neurosurgery at McGill University and a professor of Psychology at the Montreal Neurological Institute.Brenda Milner Wins Balzan Prize for Cognitive Neurosciences . (2011). Government of Canada. She turned 100 in July 2018. ==References== ==Other websites== * Great Canadian Psychology Website – Brenda Milner Biography * Interview on Futures in Biotech (2008) * "Still Charting Memory’s Depths – A Conversation with Brenda Milner", The New York Times (2013) Category:1918 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian centenarians Category:Canadian psychologists Category:People from Manchester Category:British psychologists Category:British centenarians Category:British neuroscientists Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:Academics of McGill University Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Medical researchers
title: Brenda Milner
